bestBHT.bht: I am ready to fulfill my all-subduing obligation to carry the gospel to all classes of mankind, including you in Rome who hold no mean place among the Gentiles. As far as it depends on me, I am anxious to come and preach to you, but my will is subject to the will of God, who may have decreed it otherwise. The very same power is required to make men missionaries as to make them martyrs. Thus, my readiness indicates that the event depends on God.

Henry Alford: I am ready to preach the Gospel, as to all Gentiles, so to you, who hold no mean place among them.
Having spoken of the whole obligation resting upon him, he now infers, from that, his readiness to fulfil one principal part of it.
[He] now infers, from that, his readiness to fulfil one principal part of it.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: He feels himself under an all-subduing obligation to carry the gospel to all classes of mankind."
As adapted to and ordained equally for all."
I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also.
Marvin Vincent: To you also that are in Rome. To you refers to the christian Church, not to the population generally. In every verse, from 6 to 13, uJmeiv you refers to the Church.
John Calvin: He concludes what he had before said of his desire — that as he knew it to be his duty to spread the gospel among them, in order to gather fruit for the Lord, he was anxious to fulfill God’s calling."
I am ready," or "I am prepared," conveys the meaning sufficiently, without the other words, "As much as in me is."
By saying that he was prepared, he intimates that the event depended on another, even on God.
Philip Schaff: As far as it depends on me, I am anxious to come and preach to you, but my will is subject to the will of God, who may have decreed it otherwise.
I am ready. This is a correct paraphrase of a difficult Greek expression.
The very same power is required to make men missionaries as to make them martyrs.
Archibald T. Robertson: So as much as in me is I am ready."
Thus the according to me affair is ready."
It is an awkward idiom like to εξ υμων.
John Gill: This explains what he was a debtor to one and another for, namely, to preach the Gospel."
Expresses the readiness of his mind to that work, whatever difficulties lay in his way.
Declares what a willing mind he had to preach it also to the Romans, as elsewhere.

bhtAttempts.bht: I am ready to fulfill my all-subduing obligation to carry the gospel to all classes of mankind, including you in Rome who hold no mean place among the Gentiles. As far as it depends on me, I am anxious to come and preach to you, but my will is subject to the will of God, who may have decreed it otherwise. The very same power is required to make men missionaries as to make them martyrs. Thus, my readiness indicates that the event depends on God, and it conveys my willingness to preach the gospel to you in Rome and in every verse, to you refers to the Christian Church, not to the population generally.

I am ready to fulfill my all-subduing obligation to carry the gospel to all classes of mankind, including you in Rome who hold no mean place among the Gentiles. As far as it depends on me, I am anxious to come and preach to you, but my will is subject to the will of God, who may have decreed it otherwise. The very same power is required to make men missionaries as to make them martyrs. Thus, my readiness indicates that the event depends on God.

I am ready to fulfill my all-subduing obligation to carry the gospel to all classes of mankind, including you in Rome who hold no mean place among the Gentiles. As far as it depends on me, I am anxious to come and preach to you, but my will is subject to the will of God, who may have decreed it otherwise. The very same power is required to make men missionaries as to make them martyrs. Thus, my readiness indicates that the event depends on God.

I am ready to fulfill my all-subduing obligation to carry the gospel to all classes of mankind, including you in Rome who hold no mean place among the Gentiles. My readiness indicates that the event depends on God. As far as it depends on me, I am anxious to come and preach to you, but my will is subject to the will of God, who may have decreed it otherwise. The very same power is required to make men missionaries as to make them martyrs.

I am willing and eager to fulfill my obligation to preach the gospel to all, including you in Rome who hold a significant place among the Gentiles. While I am ready to come and preach to you, I recognize that the final decision rests with God. I understand that the same divine power is necessary to make men missionaries as it is to make them martyrs. Thus, my readiness reflects my willingness, knowing that the outcome is in God's hands.
